title: Aspects Regarding some Simulation Models for Logistic Management
abstract: Abstract The main purpose of the paper is to develop a neural network application that could predict supplier problems in terms of stock management, lead time and production. Stocks of goods that manufacturers would classify as raw materials stocks are, in a special sense, goods in early stages of the production process. In a logic-based economic competitiveness, the company which holds the largest stock is underperforming! Technically, the stock is inevitable and in some cases even desirable; economically it is associate with an asset value stock, therefore, it should be minimized. Minimizing the value, the costs will also be minimized.

motivations: Companies face challenges in managing stocks, lead times, and production due to supplier problems.
Holding large stocks can lead to underperformance and increased costs in a competitive economy.
objectives: Develop a neural network application to predict supplier problems in stock management, lead time, and production.
methods: Apply neural network technology to simulate and predict supplier-related issues in logistics management.
results: Minimize stock values and associated costs by optimizing logistics management through predictive modeling.
llama_json.research_subject: Predictive modeling for logistics management using neural networks

motivations: There is a need for predicting supplier problems in terms of stock management, lead time, and production.
The economic competitiveness requires minimizing the stock value and associated costs.
objectives: Develop a neural network application to predict supplier problems related to stock management, lead time, and production.
methods: Use a neural network application to model and predict supplier problems in logistic management.
results: Enable better stock management and cost minimization through predictive modeling.
openai_json.research_subject: Simulation models for logistic management using neural networks

motivations: Companies face challenges in predicting supplier problems related to stock management, lead time, and production, which can impact their operational efficiency.
Excessive inventory holding leads to underperformance and increased costs, necessitating optimization strategies for stock management.
objectives: Develop a neural network application capable of predicting supplier-related problems in stock management, lead time, and production.
Minimize inventory value and associated costs while maintaining necessary stock levels for operational efficiency.
methods: Design and implement neural network models for predicting supplier issues and optimizing inventory management.
Develop simulation models for logistic management to analyze and improve stock optimization strategies.
results: Enable companies to anticipate and mitigate supplier-related disruptions through predictive analytics.
Achieve cost reduction and improved economic performance through optimized inventory management.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Neural network-based simulation models for predicting supplier problems and optimizing inventory management
